tr_quotes.quote: Sevgi teleskoptan bakar kıskançlık ise mikroskoptan.
tr_quotes.author: John Billings

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlık ruhun sarılığıdır.
tr_quotes.author: John Dryden

tr_quotes.quote: Bütün kötü tutkuların en kirlisi kıskançlıktır.
tr_quotes.author: A. Strindberg

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanç daha çok sever ama kıskanç olmayan daha iyi sever.
tr_quotes.author: Moliere

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanılmayan imrenilecek bir fazileti olmayandır.
tr_quotes.author: Aeschylus

tr_quotes.quote: Haset başkalarının balını kendi ağzına zehir etmektir.
tr_quotes.author: Cenap Şehabettin

tr_quotes.quote: İnsan ancak bir başkasına ait olan erdem için kıskançlık duyar.
tr_quotes.author: B. Spinoza

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlık insanı alçaltan ve küçülten bir duygudur.
tr_quotes.author: Lev Tolstoy

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlıkla kuruntunun gözleri son derece keskindir.
tr_quotes.author: Wolfgang Van Goethe

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlık insanı kötüleri değil iyileri kötülemeye yöneltir.
tr_quotes.author: F. R. Chaleaubriand

tr_quotes.quote: Herkesten kıskanacak kadar değil herkesi kıskandıracak kadar sevsin.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Haset ateş nasıl odunu yer yutarsa iyilikleri yer yutar mahveder.
tr_quotes.author: Hz. Muhammed (s.a.v)

tr_quotes.quote: Acınmaktansa, kıskanılmak daha iyidir.
tr_quotes.author: Heredot

tr_quotes.quote: Kişi diğer kişilerin başarılarını düşünmez ise yaşamda canlı olarak kalır.
tr_quotes.author: Lao Tzu

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlık duyguların en korkuncu olduğu kadar en aldatıcısıdır da.
tr_quotes.author: Will Oursler

tr_quotes.quote: Haset, bütün duygular içinde en can sıkıcı ve devamlı olanıdır.
tr_quotes.author: F.Bacon

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanan, elde edemez.
tr_quotes.author: Şinasi

tr_quotes.quote: Gurur kıskançlık ve hırs insanların kalplerini ateşleyen üç ateştir.
tr_quotes.author: Dante Alighieri

tr_quotes.quote: Başkalarının iyi haline bakıp üzülme senin haline de bakıp kıskanan çok kişi vardır.
tr_quotes.author: Russy Rubutin

tr_quotes.quote: Biraz kıskançlık duyarsanız yaşarken ölmenin ne demek olduğunu anlarsınız.
tr_quotes.author: Will Oursler

tr_quotes.quote: Söyleyen ve haykıran kıskançlık daima beceriksizdir. Susan kıskançlıktan korkmalı.
tr_quotes.author: Rlverol

tr_quotes.quote: Herhangi birini kıskanmaktan ya da kin beslemekten kurtaracak sihirbaz henüz yeryüzüne gelmiş değildir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanç insan başkalarını küçük düşürmek isteğiyle kendini gözden düşüren zavallıdır.
tr_quotes.author: Archibald Rutledge

tr_quotes.quote: Memleket değiştirmekle kıskançlık cimrilik kararsızlık korku ve tutku bizi bırakmaz.
tr_quotes.author: Montaigne

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlık daima sevgiyle beraber doğar fakat her zaman sevgi öldükten sonra ölmez.
tr_quotes.author: François de la Rochefaucauld

tr_quotes.quote: Pek az kişi vardır ki iyi talihli bir dostun başarılarını kıskançlık duymadan kutlayabilsin.
tr_quotes.author: Aeschylus

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlığımız kıskandığımız kişilerin mutluluğundan daha uzun ömürlüdür.
tr_quotes.author: François de la Rochefaucauld

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlık bütün fenalıkların en büyüğü ve ona sebebiyet veren kimselere en az merhamet edenidir.
tr_quotes.author: François de la Rochefaucauld

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanç olmayan insan bulmak çıkar düşkünü olmayan insan bulmaktan daha güçtür.
tr_quotes.author: François de la Rochefaucauld

tr_quotes.quote: Kim kıskanırsa kördür kim nefret ederse sağırdır kim kızarsa topaldır sadece kim severse her şeyi tamdır.
tr_quotes.author: Yunan atasözü

tr_quotes.quote: Şeytanda insandaki özelliklerin birisi hariç hepsi vardır. Şeytanda eksik olan tek nimet aşk. Şeytanın insanı çekememesi aşksızlığındandır.
tr_quotes.author: Şems-İ Tebrizi

tr_quotes.quote: İnsan seviyorsa kaybetmekten korkar. Kıskançlık da bir kaybetme korkusudur Kıskanmıyorsa eğer yeterince sevmiyordur.
tr_quotes.author: Oğuz Atay

tr_quotes.quote: Dünya böyle hiç kimse başkasının ne çeşit olursa olsun meziyetlerini ona bağışlamıyor bunları elinden de alamadığı için küçültüyor inkâr ediyor ya da tersini söylüyor.
tr_quotes.author: Wolfgang Van Goethe

tr_quotes.quote: Niyeti kötü olanın attığı ok kendine döner.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Yüzümüze karşı cümle kuramayanlar, arkamızdan kompozisyon yazıyor…
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: İnsanlar seninle konuşmayı bıraktıklarında arkandan konuşmaya başlarlar.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: İnsan ancak bir başkasına ait olan erdem için kıskançlık duyar.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Sen buna kıskançlık diyebilirsin ama ben buna kaybetme korkusu diyorum.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanmak yerine, örnek almayı deneseniz belki içte içe büyüyen fesatlığınız da son bulur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: İyi ki hayallerimizi görmüyorlar… Yoksa onu da kıskanırlar!
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanç olmayan insan bulmak, çıkarlarına düşkün olmayan bir insan bulmaktan daha zordur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Büyük meziyetlere sahip olmanın en gerçek alameti, hasetsiz olmaktır.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Haset insan, kendini daima başkalarıyla kıyaslar, kıyaslama olmayan yerde haset olmaz.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Nimet sahibi olup da hasetçilerin hasedinden salim kalan yoktur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kim başkasının elindekine göz dikerse şüphesiz Allah’ın kazasına kızmış olur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanç birine beddua etme, onun peşindeki haset gibi bir düşman zaten ona yeter.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanmak yerine örnek almayı deneseniz belki içten içe büyüyen fesatlığınız da son bulur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kabiliyetsiz olmak suç ya da kusur değil ama karaktersiz olmak çok büyük kusurdur.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskanırlar… Gülen gözlerini, bitmeyen enerjini, tebessümünü ve acıların bile sana kattığı gücü kıskanırlar.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

tr_quotes.quote: Kıskançlıkta kuruntunun gözleri son derece keskindir.
tr_quotes.author: Anonim

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy in romance is like salt in food. A little can enhance the savor, but too much can spoil the pleasure and, under certain circumstances, can be life-threatening.
en_quotes.author: Maya Angelou

en_quotes.quote: He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: It is not love that is blind, but jealousy.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: ealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy - in fact, they are almost incompatible; one emotion hardly leaves room for the other
en_quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy is a disease. Get well soon.
en_quotes.author: Paris Hilton

en_quotes.quote: So full of artless jealousy is guilt, it spills itself in fearing to be split.
en_quotes.author: Gertrude

en_quotes.quote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything.
en_quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

en_quotes.quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own...
en_quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

en_quotes.quote: People only rain on your parade because they’re jealous of your sun and tired of their shade.
Jealousy is when you count someone else's blessings instead of your own.
en_quotes.author: Amanda Metcalf

en_quotes.quote: Whoever envies another confesses his superiority.
en_quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

en_quotes.quote: Welcome to the wonderful world of jealousy,' he thought. 'For the price of admission, you get a splitting headache, a nearly irresistible urge to commit murder, and an inferiority complex. Yippee.
en_quotes.author: J.R. Ward

en_quotes.quote: People hate those who make them feel their own inferiority.
en_quotes.author: Lord Chesterfield

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
en_quotes.author: Robert A. Heinlein

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy isn't a pleasant quality, but if it isn't overdone (and if it's combined with modesty), apart from its inconvenience there's even something touching about it.
en_quotes.author: Milan Kundera

en_quotes.quote: The worst part of success is trying to find someone who is happy for you.
en_quotes.author: Bette Midler

en_quotes.quote: Nothing brings on jealousy like laughter.
en_quotes.author: Françoise Sagan

en_quotes.quote: Anger, resentment, and jealousy don't change the heart of others - it only changes yours.
en_quotes.author: Shannon Alder

en_quotes.quote: Noble hearts are neither jealous nor afraid because jealousy spells doubt and fear spells pettiness.
en_quotes.author: Honoré de Balzac

en_quotes.quote: Envy is for people who don’t have the self-esteem to be jealous.
en_quotes.author: Bauvar

en_quotes.quote: Surrounded by the flames of jealousy, the jealous one winds up, like the scorpion, turning the poisoned sting against himself
en_quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

en_quotes.quote: Humans are suspicious and jealous creatures. When they see something perfect, they want to find a flaw.
en_quotes.author: Gosho Aoyama

en_quotes.quote: Envy is the central fact of American life.
en_quotes.author: Gore Vidal

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy, that dragon which slays love under the pretense of keeping it alive.
en_quotes.author: Havelock Ellis

en_quotes.quote: I am convinced that the jealous, the angry, the bitter, and the egotistical are the first to race to the top of mountains. A confident person enjoys the journey, the people they meet along the way and sees life not as a competition.
en_quotes.author: Shannon Alder

en_quotes.quote: Man will do many things to get himself loved; he will do all things to get himself envied.
en_quotes.author: Mark Twain

en_quotes.quote: The only thing more frustrating than slanderers is those foolish enough to listen to them.
en_quotes.author: Criss Jami

en_quotes.quote: No one can have all he wants, but a man can refrain from wanting what he has not, and cheerfully make the best of a bird in the hand.
en_quotes.author: Seneca

en_quotes.quote: Trifles light as air; Are to the jealous confirmations strong as proofs of holy writ.
en_quotes.author: William Shakespeare

en_quotes.quote: The thermometer of success is merely the jealousy of the malcontents.
en_quotes.author: Salvador Dali

en_quotes.quote: Famous Harry Potter,' said Malfoy. 'Can't even go to a bookshop without making the front page.
en_quotes.author: J.K. Rowling

en_quotes.quote: My jealousy is a living thing. Shifting, changing, growing. Like my rage and my mother's regret.
en_quotes.author: Katja Millay

en_quotes.quote: There's always this one girl. She's desperate and she's weird and she's jealous, and you're stuck with her, no matter how hard you try to get her off your back.
en_quotes.author: Courtney Summers

en_quotes.quote: Insecure people only eclipse your sun because they’re jealous of your daylight and tired of their dark, starless nights.
en_quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

en_quotes.quote: But jealous souls will not be answered so. They are not ever jealous for the cause, but jealous for they’re jealous. It is a monster begot upon itself, born on itself.
en_quotes.author: William Shakespeare

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.
en_quotes.author: George Eliot

en_quotes.quote: Never hate jealous people. They are jealous because they think you are better than them.
en_quotes.author: Paulo Coelho

en_quotes.quote: Isn't it kind of silly to think that tearing someone else down builds you up?
en_quotes.author: Sean Covey

en_quotes.quote: What is jealousy but a reflection of your own failures?
en_quotes.author: Michael Connelly

en_quotes.quote: I’m jealous of every minute you spend with him, of every concerned emotion you send his way, of every tear shed, of every glance, every touch, and every thought.
en_quotes.author: Colleen Houck

en_quotes.quote: I refused to believe that love could take any other form than mine: I measured love by the extent of my jealousy, and by that standard of course she could not love me at all.
en_quotes.author: Graham Greene

en_quotes.quote: Men, though they know full well how much women are worth and how great the benefits we bring them, nonetheless seek to destroy us out of envy for our merits.
en_quotes.author: Moderata Fonte

en_quotes.quote: He was jealous of her future, and she of his past.
en_quotes.author: Anaïs Nin

en_quotes.quote: I’ve never been jealous before I met you, it burns, luv. Like silver through my veins.
en_quotes.author: Jeaniene Frost

en_quotes.quote: Often those that criticize others reveal what he himself lacks.
en_quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

en_quotes.quote: Cruel people offer pity when they no longer feel threatened. However, kind people offer compassion and understanding regardless.
en_quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

en_quotes.quote: Resentment is like drinking poison and waiting for the other person to die.
en_quotes.author: Carrie Fisher

en_quotes.quote: Margaret was not a ready lover, but where she loved she loved passionately, and with no small degree of jealousy.
en_quotes.author: Elizabeth Gaskell

en_quotes.quote: And yes, I’ll admit, I am jealous.
en_quotes.author: Colleen Houck

en_quotes.quote: Our envy always lasts longer than the happiness of those we envy.
en_quotes.author: François de La Rochefoucauld

en_quotes.quote: Why, why is this? Think'st thou I'd make a life of jealousy, to follow still the changes of the moon with fresh suspicions?
en_quotes.author: Othello

en_quotes.quote: O, beware, my lord, of jealousy! It is the green-eyed monster which doth mock the meat it feeds on.
en_quotes.author: Iago

en_quotes.quote: A heart at peace gives life to the body, but envy rots the bones.
en_quotes.author: Proverbs 14:30

en_quotes.quote: Surely resentment destroys the fool, and jealousy kills the simple.
en_quotes.author: Job 5:2

en_quotes.quote: In jealousy, there is more of self-love than love.
en_quotes.author: Francois De La Rochefoucault

en_quotes.quote: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: For God's sake, let's take the word 'possess' and put a brick round its neck and drown it. We can't possess one another. We can only give and hazard all we have.
en_quotes.author: Dorothy L. Sayers

en_quotes.quote: Men are jealous of every woman.
en_quotes.author: Jan Neruda

en_quotes.quote: She had loved him for such a long time,' she thought. 'How was it that she did now know him at all?
en_quotes.author: Cassandra Clare

en_quotes.quote: The moment you have to recruit people to put another person down, in order to convince someone of your value is the day you dishonor your children, your parents, and your God.
en_quotes.author: Shannon L. Alder

en_quotes.quote: I love being in love, but I also love other things, like not being jealous, overly sensitive, or needy.
en_quotes.author: Dark Jar Tin Zoo

en_quotes.quote: Perhaps not dangerous, but young and inarguable good-looking... Kai hated him immediately.
en_quotes.author: Marissa Meyer

en_quotes.quote: A lot of people get so hung up on what they can't have that they don't think for a second about whether they really want it
en_quotes.author: Lionel Shriver

en_quotes.quote: I said I was impressed, Martha. I'm beside myself with jealousy. What do you want me to do, throw up?
en_quotes.author: Edward Albee

en_quotes.quote: When emerging from humble beginnings, those around you tend to underestimate your authenticity because they knew you before you were 'somebody'.
en_quotes.author: Criss Jami

en_quotes.quote: You can only be jealous of someone who has something you think you ought to have yourself.
en_quotes.author: Margaret Atwood

en_quotes.quote: Men are jealous of every woman, even when they don’t have the slightest interest in her themselves.
en_quotes.author: Jan Neruda

en_quotes.quote: Moral indignation is jealousy with a halo.
en_quotes.author: H.G. Wells

en_quotes.quote: Do not overrate what you have received, nor envy others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
en_quotes.author: Buddha

en_quotes.quote: Wisdom I know is social. She seeks her fellows. But Beauty is jealous, and illy bears the presence of a rival.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

en_quotes.quote: The closer you get to success, the more the heat of the naysayers may increase. Work even harder, listen, answer all questions and objections - focus on the work, not yourself. Don't expect everyone to cheer your successes. Some will be jealous.
en_quotes.author: JLisa Marie Stringer

en_quotes.quote: Some children feel that their place among their siblings is lesser for one reason or another and the result of this is jealousy, encouraging equality among every child in the home is the best way to avoid this type of acting out.
en_quotes.author: Sophie Banks

en_quotes.quote: Sibling rivalry is defined as the jealous and competitive spirit that often exists between brothers and sisters. Rivalry is typical in any family with more than one child.
en_quotes.author: Felicity Bauer

en_quotes.quote: You can be the moon and still be jealous of the stars.
en_quotes.author: Gary Allan

en_quotes.quote: Your time is too precious to be sacrificed in wasted days combating the menial forces of hate, jealously, and envy.
en_quotes.author: Og Mandino

en_quotes.quote: Do not listen to nay-sayers, or those who may be envious or jealous of your intentions. See the possibilities. The world belongs to the doers not the nay-sayers.
en_quotes.author: Byron Pulsifer

en_quotes.quote: If we trace the evolutionary history of humankind, we find that part of the reason we suffer from jealous thoughts and emotions about the past and (the present) is because it has been hardwired into us since the dawn of time to do so.
en_quotes.author: Jeff Billings

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy is never satisfied with anything short of an omniscience that would detect the subtlest fold of the heart.
en_quotes.author: George Eliot

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy cuts across, and does not necessarily blend with, other aspects of a relationship.
en_quotes.author: Terri Apter

en_quotes.quote: To live each day also means to allow forgiveness. By holding a grudge or allowing spite to rule your day, you are placing emphasis on the negative and not on the positive. Get rid of envy or jealousy
en_quotes.author: Byron Pulsifer

en_quotes.quote: Blessed is he who has learned to admire but not envy, to follow but not imitate, to praise but not flatter, and to lead but not manipulate.
en_quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

en_quotes.quote: If two people can fully trust one another and are good at communicating with each other, jealousy will never win. NEVER!
en_quotes.author: Robert Rain

en_quotes.quote: A heart at peace gives life to the body, but envy rots the bones.
en_quotes.author: Proverbs 14:30

en_quotes.quote: If you're suffering from problems of self-esteem or from constant bouts of jealousy, it didn't happen overnight.
en_quotes.author: Bailey Jackson

en_quotes.quote: Overcoming your jealousy is a question of learning to tell the difference between a real situation in which something isn't quite right and a case of your emotions going into overdrive.
en_quotes.author: Eric Monroe

en_quotes.quote: Comparison is a very foolish attitude, because each person is unique and incomparable. Once this understanding settles in you, jealousy disappears.
en_quotes.author: Osho

en_quotes.quote: For some bizarre reason, jealousy in relationships is seen as something of a compliment, even a little bit cute in the right context.
en_quotes.author: Simeon Lindstrom

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy has a lot to do with how people see themselves. If you are comparing yourself to someone, stop doing this. You were created to be exactly who you are.
en_quotes.author: Stanley Steel

en_quotes.quote: Dismiss personal jealousy and complaints. Learn to have tolerance and patience, both with yourself and with others.
en_quotes.author: Thomas Erikson

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy lives upon doubts. It becomes madness or ceases entirely as soon as we pass from doubt to certainty.
en_quotes.author: Francois de la Rochefoucauld

en_quotes.quote: Jealousy is not a barometer by which the depth of love can be read, it merely records the degree of the lover's insecurity.
en_quotes.author: Margaret Mead

en_quotes.quote: Aside from the real threats that are often present in our lives, there are other triggers of jealousy that are rooted in our own problems.
en_quotes.author: Ryan Help
